Class MouseInputStrategy

java.lang.Object
com.aoopproject.common.input.MouseInputStrategy
All Implemented Interfaces:
InputStrategy
public class MouseInputStrategy extends Object implements InputStrategy
An InputStrategy that captures mouse clicks on a SameGameViewSwing.GamePanel. It converts mouse coordinates to tile coordinates and generates SameGameSelectActions.

      public MouseInputStrategy(AbstractGameController controller)

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(GameView gameView)
      Description copied from interface: InputStrategy
      Initializes the input strategy. This can be used to set up listeners or resources. For example, a Swing-based input strategy might register mouse listeners to a specific component.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface InputStrategy
      Parameters:
      gameView - The primary game view, which might be needed for context (e.g., to attach listeners to GUI components). Can be null if the strategy does not depend on a view.

    • dispose

      public void dispose()
      Description copied from interface: InputStrategy
      Cleans up any resources used by the input strategy. Called when the strategy is no longer needed or when the game is shutting down.
      Specified by:
      dispose in interface InputStrategy
